pages.text: The most basic power available to a druid is spellcraft. To make, each spell requires specific components, which are broken down in a $(l:apparatus/mortar)Mortar & Pestle$() into spell dust. This dust can then be imbued into a staff.$(br2)In addition to the creation, casting spells require material components in the form of herbs.

Once the spell dust has been crafted, it is imbued into the staff with an Imbuer. During the process, further reagents can be added to permanently modify the spell.$(br2)Imbuement will never override a old spell slot, instead placing the new spell in the first available empty slot, if there is one.

pages.title: Imbuer
pages.text: Staff and spell dust can be inserted into the imbuer to begin the process. It will take a short amount of time before the upgraded staff is returned, and during this time further reagents can be applied. Other uses for this device may be uncovered in the future.

pages.title: Staff
pages.text: In addition to the staff and spell dust, material components in the form of herbs must be provided from a $(l:apparatus/component_pouch)Component Pouch$() or $(l:apparatus/apothecary_pouch)Apothecary Pouch$().

pages.title: Manipulating the Staff
pages.text: The staff is capable of holding up to 5 spells. The currently selected spell is always displayed when the druid hovers over. Holding shift will allow show all imbued spells.$(br2)Sneaking while right-clicking will cycle through to the next available spells. Additional keybinds exist should you need them.

pages.title: Casting
pages.text: Once a spell is selected, simply hold the staff in either hand. Depending on the type, be it one that triggers instantly or requires a period of concentration, right-click or hold right-click to activate respectively.$(br2)If the correct components are available, they will be consumed (and a visual alert will show you your remaining stock of these herbs) and the spell will be cast.

pages.title: Removing Spells
pages.text: As the power of the staff is limited and can only maintain 5 spells, it may become necessary for you to remove a spell. Simply select the slot you wish to void, and imbue the staff with $(l:resources/runic_dust)Runic Dust$(). The returned staff will now be without that spell.
